lines.text:
[recovering from slipping on the ice]
I fell, and landed on my...
[looks at his bottom, then hides it with his cape]
on, on the ice.
[looking out the window]
Wow! Will you look at that!
Well, I think I might. I'll just pick myself up and... oh! What's this? Heavens! I'M BOLTED TO THE WALL!

[Beast glumly walks away as Lumiere sees the present that Belle left for him]
Oooooh, it's for you, Master. It's from - a girl.

[Looking back]
Mrs. Potts?

[Irate]
No, from Belle!
Belle?
[Beast prepares to open the present but Lumiere stops him]
Ah-ah-ah, Master, you can't open it!
Why not? It's for me, isn't it?
Because it's not yet Christmas.
[Beast turns away in a huff]
Master, we all understand how you feel about Christmas. But when a woman gives a man a gift, she's saying, "I care about you."
But I don't have a gift for her.
It's not too late.

[huffs again]
Well, I guess I'll get her a little something.
You said you'd never leave.
I wasn't trying to leave. I was just trying to make you happy.
You broke your word. And for that, you'll rot in this dungeon forever.
[slams the door and locks it]

[tearfully]
I should've known you'd never be anything - but a beast.
That's not a tree! That's just a weed *wishin'* it was a tree!
It's a... a Yule log.
Huh?
A Yule log. It's a wonderful tradition. One log is chosen, and everyone in the house touches it and makes a Christmas wish.
Wishes are stupid. You made a Christmas wish last year. Is this what you wished for?
[unleashes a flock of bats, which promptly disappears]
No. But I will keep wishing. And when the log is burnt on Christmas morning...
There will BE no Christmas.
But...

[shouts]
NO! I am the master here!

[horrified]
How can you be so selfish?
You cannot possibly understand. You have no idea what it's like to lose *everything*, to be *trapped* in your own castle, to be a - a - uh...
Prisoner? The only one holding us prisoner here is you. Well, I'm not giving up!
Belle... what's - Christmas?
Oh, Chip, you must know about Christmas. Stockings in front of the fire. Tree? Tinsle? Presents?
Presents! Will I get one?
Of course, everyone gets a present on Christmas.
Aw, even the master?
Yes, even the master.
So, Beast gets girl and it's a happy ending for everyone. Enchantment lifted and Forte fades into the background; no longer important, no longer needed. *I think not!*

[singing]
As long as there's Christmas, I truly believe that hope is the greatest of the gifts we receive.
Doesn't look so special to me.
Oh, Chip, I'm sorry. Nothing's changed.
I told you nothing would change. I told you the master would not allow this. I told you Christmas was a hopeless folly. But, I was wrong.
[singing]
As long as there's Christmas, I truly believe that hope is the greatest of the gifts we'll receive. As long as our guiding star shines above...

[at the same time as Angelique]
That hope is the greatest of the gifts we'll recieve. As long as our guiding star shines above...
There'll always be Christmas.
So there always will be a time when the world is filled with peace and love.
clock boarding; no, snow clocking! Whatever! Ha-ha!
Forbid Christmas? No one can forbid Christmas.
And you said it was impossible!
No, no, no. I said it was impossible without - *me*.
[Belle, Chip, and Lumiere are climbing up a long and narrow staircase]
1,001. 1,002. 1,003. Are we there yet?

[sighs]
Not yet.
Oh boy, there are sure a lot of steps here! 1,007. 1,008. 1,009. 1,010...
You have been deceived by your own cold heart - a curse upon your house and all within it.
[the enchantress puts the spoiled prince and everyone under a spell]
Until you have found someone to love you as you are, you shall remain forever a beast.
[echoes]

[as she guards the dining room]
No, no, no, no, no, no, no! They cannot mix bells with holly. Although, I have to admit, not bad for amateurs.
[the Beast approaches the dining room and wrecks everything in anger, and leaves; Angelique comes out of hiding]

[solemnly]
I knew this was hopeless.
Maestro! Stop! Just what do you think you're doing?
Don't you see, Fife? They can't fall in love if they're DEAD!
a big old windbag!
[Fife laughs nervously]

[plays loud music]
You could've joined me, Fife! But I see my triumph is a solo act!
[Forte laughs evilly as Fife notices a single blank music sheet]
My solo - it's blank!
So naive. You're second fiddle, Fife, and that's all you'll ever be!
[plays loud music again]
Forte!
[bursts through the doors]
Enough! Aaargh!
Heavens, Master!
[mocking the Beast]
"You're not singing"!

[after the flashback to the Beast's transformation]
But we've come so far since then. We've - risen above the tragedy.

[growling, he knocks his chair over, wondering where Belle is]
Where is sheeee?
I believe she's gone to the boiler room, or - so a little birdie told me.

[chuckles nervously]
Tweet, tweet, tweet!

[as Forte plays]
Forte! Stop the noise!
Noise? Noise?
[scoffs]
This is my masterpiece.

[bellows]
Christmas? She's planning Christmas?
Yes. Awful, isn't it?

[sitting down at his chair in front of the fireplace]
Perhaps she doesn't *know* how I feel about Christmas.
But she *does* know. She just doesn't care, like *I* do. She's actually trying to bring Christmas back to the castle. And you know how much we despise Christmas.

[sighs]
The day my life ended.

[singing]
You belong side by side, you should never be apart, 'cause when you're both together, you're really twice as smart.

[spoken]
Twice as smart... she does have a point.
Yes. Well, two heads are better than one.
Let's give Belle the Christmas she's always wanted!
Hi, Belle.

[chuckling briefly]
Hello! Chip, do you know what day it is?
Well, it's not Tuesday...
No, silly. Today is December 24th. The day before Christmas.
And what a beautiful day it is.
Mademoiselle, please. I am Maestro Forte, court composer and your most humble servant.
Please to meet you, Monsieur Forte. I'm Belle.
